channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Security Concerns Grow for Israeli Olympians in Paris
item.description: Concerns for the Israeli team — which has been shrouded in protection at every Games since 1972 — have substantially increased since the Oct. 7 terrorist attacks and the war in Gaza.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Killed Leader of Hamas’s Armed Wing Last Month
item.description: The fate of the leader, Muhammad Deif, who was a target in a bombardment that Gazan officials say killed at least 90 people, has been unclear. The announcement, which Hamas has not commented on, came as Iran held funeral prayers for another Hamas leader, Ismail Haniyeh, whose death in a strike this week has amplified fears of a wider regional war.

item.title: China’s gig workers stress over their incomes as Baidu ‘silly radish’ robotaxis flood the streets
item.description: More than 500 electric robotaxis built by Baidu Inc. currently ply Wuhan's streets, with plans for an additional 1,000 to be deployed by year-end.

item.title: Fears of Wider Mideast Conflict Deepen, With U.S. Seen as ‘Not in Control’
item.description: American officials said they had no advance warning of the attack on the Hamas leader in Iran, raising worries of a power vacuum that could lead to a broader geopolitical crisis.

item.title: Security Concerns Grow for Israeli Olympians in Paris
item.description: Concerns for the Israeli team — which has been shrouded in protection at every Games since 1972 — have substantially increased since the Oct. 7 terrorist attacks and the war in Gaza.

item.title: Bank of England makes first interest rate cut since pandemic in nail-bitingly close vote
item.description: The “finely balanced” 5-4 vote signals the Bank's ongoing caution to further reductions, with no guidance given on where interest rates may settle.

item.title: Bank of England Cuts Interest Rates for First Time Since 2020
item.description: Central bank policymakers lowered rates to 5 percent amid lower inflation in Britain, but they warned that future rate cuts would come slowly.

item.title: Fears of Wider Mideast Conflict Deepen, With U.S. Seen as ‘Not in Control’
item.description: American officials said they had no advance warning of the attack on the Hamas leader in Iran, raising worries of a power vacuum that could lead to a broader geopolitical crisis.

item.title: Americans: If you want to move abroad because of the election, Spain is your best bet
item.description: Looking to leave the U.S. amid the political upheaval? If you can do your job remotely, research shows that Spain comes out on top.

item.title: Trump Falsely Questions Harris’s Race, and 9/11 Guilty Pleas
item.description: Plus, why so few world records in Paris?

item.title: How Track’s Athletics Integrity Unit Catches Doping Cheats
item.description: Track and field’s antidoping arm, the Athletics Integrity Unit, has announced a string of cases in recent months. Is that the sign of a problem, or proof that its approach is working?

item.title: Cities no longer need to be rich to be smart as AI ‘levels out the playing field,’ urban experts say
item.description: Data can help cities who are not that rich become 'smart' and the cost of data collection is coming down because of advances in AI.

item.title: The Threat of More War
item.description: We examine the contradictions in the Middle East.

item.title: Muhammad Deif, a Top Hamas Commander, Is Dead, Israel Says
item.description: Mr. Deif, who had survived several previous Israeli assassination attempts, was the No. 2 Hamas leader in Gaza. Israel said it killed him in a strike last month in southern Gaza.

item.title: Trump tried to sway the Fed and now Powell is fighting back
item.description: Fighting words: "We're a non political agency. We don't want to be involved in politics in any way."
